messages.subject: March/April HEM
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/3/03 2:53:55 PM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/3/03 2:53:55 PM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Ren - I loved your article, and it's cool that we're sharing a page :0).
It is nice to see such an unschooly issue. ~Rue >>

Thanks Rue, I liked yours too!! It was full of unschooling stuff, very
awesome.
When I got my issue and turned to my page, the first thing I said was "COOL,
I know Rue!!" :)
Then Mary Gold was there and Sandra's regular article and I just felt right
at home.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett

messages.subject: March/April HEM
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/3/03 2:53:55 PM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:  You are so completely
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/3/03 2:53:55 PM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Thanks for the inspiration Ren. >>

You are so completely welcome. I feel humbled that something I wrote could
help in some small way.
I think you have a right to feel fear right now.....and your being aware of
it will help it not control. Hang in there.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: March/April HEM
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/3/03 9:48:13 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... It was a wonderful article.  It was so nice to see so many unschooling tid bits and articles in
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/3/03 9:48:13 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Wilkinson6@... writes:

> I hadn't read any of my issue of HEM yet, and just read Ren's while
> re starting my computer.
> It was wonderful!
>

It was a wonderful article. It was so nice to see so many unschooling tid
bits and articles in this issue. I have subscribed and unsubscribed in the
past because it was too homeschooly with not much unschooling in it. It
didn't seem to fit with how we are now and I wasn't getting much out of it
but this issue was GREAT!!!
Pam G.
(still having trouble being Pam G. I have always been the only Pam, never
knew another Pam until now. LOL)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] March/April HEM
messages.msgSnippet: Ren - I loved your article, and it s cool that we re sharing a page :0). It is nice to see such an unschooly issue.  ~Rue Pay no attention to the man behind
messages.messageBody:
Ren - I loved your article, and it's cool that we're sharing a page :0).
It is nice to see such an unschooly issue. ~Rue

"Pay no attention to the man behind the curtain."


-----Original Message-----
From: starsuncloud@... [mailto:starsuncloud@...]
Sent: Sunday, March 02, 2003 6:23 PM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] March/April HEM


In a message dated 3/2/03 11:54:41 AM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Looking at the table of contents, it was great to see that so many
of the
main articles were unschooling ones. Cool! >>

Yes, it was very cool. I got the issue and was really thrilled to see I
was
amongst such writers as Rue Kream, Mary Gold (Zenmomma) and Sandra of
course.

messages.subject: Re: March/April HEM
messages.msgSnippet: I hadn t read any of my issue of HEM yet, and just read Ren s while re starting my computer. It was wonderful! It s just what I needed to read. I m having
messages.messageBody:
I hadn't read any of my issue of HEM yet, and just read Ren's while
re starting my computer.
It was wonderful!
It's just what I needed to read.
I'm having trouble with fear at this point and time and I so don't
want to be this way.
The joy is all around me, and I need to let it win.
Thanks for the inspiration Ren.
Joanna

messages.subject: March/April HEM
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/2/03 11:54:41 AM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/2/03 11:54:41 AM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Looking at the table of contents, it was great to see that so many of the
main articles were unschooling ones. Cool! >>

Yes, it was very cool. I got the issue and was really thrilled to see I was
amongst such writers as Rue Kream, Mary Gold (Zenmomma) and Sandra of course.
A bit intimidating for this newbie...but inspirational too.
I have loved reading Mary and Sandra's stuff ever since I came to
unschooling.com, so that was really cool of course.

Another thing, I'm working on a little piece about last years conference and
this is the absolute last call for any comments or quotes. I am finishing up
editing this weekend, so if I'm going to squeeze a little something in, NOW
is the time.
Anyone? Thanks y'all...

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
